parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The brake failure due to overheating can cause the brakes to fail, leading to accidents or loss of control, which can result in serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal becomes hard
the brakes fail to respond
the brakes overheat
the vehicle is unable to stop
the vehicle is difficult to control.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Brake Failure due to Caliper Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The brake failure due to caliper issues can cause the brakes to fail, leading to accidents or loss of control, which can result in serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brakes fail to respond
the brakes are difficult to apply
the vehicle is unable to stop
the vehicle is difficult to control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The loose steering and wandering issues can cause the vehicle to drift or veer off course, making it difficult to control, especially on uneven surfaces, which can lead to accidents or loss of vehicle stability.
symptoms: The vehicle's steering feels loose
the vehicle wanders or drifts from side to side
the vehicle requires oversteering to maintain direction
the vehicle exhibits excessive play in the steering system
the vehicle is difficult to control on uneven surfaces.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Premature Wear of Steering System Components
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The premature wear of steering system components can cause the vehicle to lose stability and control, making it difficult to steer, which can lead to accidents or loss of vehicle stability.
symptoms: The steering system components
such as the idler arm and bell crank
wear out prematurely
the vehicle's steering feels loose
the vehicle wanders or drifts from side to side
the vehicle requires frequent replacement of steering system components.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel line connector can cause fuel leaks, which can lead to engine stalling, fires, and accidents, posing a significant risk to vehicle safety and occupants.
symptoms: Fuel odor inside the vehicle
fuel leaking from the fuel lines
engine stalling
vehicle breakdown.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Transmission Design Flaw - Lack of Parking Pawl
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The absence of a parking pawl in the transmission design can cause the vehicle to roll away unexpectedly, even when parked on a level surface, which can lead to accidents, injuries, or property damage.
symptoms: The vehicle rolls backward or forward without warning when parked
the emergency parking brake is not strong enough to hold the vehicle in place
the vehicle moves unexpectedly when the transmission is in park.
